meanings.sent1: She jockeyed the pieces of the puzzle into place.
meanings.sent2: He jockeyed his way through the crowded room to reach the exit.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel jockeyed the nut out of the bird's reach.
meanings.sent4: The skilled negotiator jockeyed the terms of the agreement in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The experienced pilot jockeyed the plane through turbulent weather.

meanings.definition: To compete as a jockey in horse racing
meanings.sent1: She jockeyed in the horse race at the county fair.
meanings.sent2: He jockeyed for position at the starting line of the race.
meanings.sent3: The jockey jockeyed for the lead, urging his horse forward.
meanings.sent4: The young jockey jockeyed his horse to victory in the final stretch.
meanings.sent5: The skilled jockey jockeyed his mount expertly around the track.

meanings.definition: To handle or control something skillfully
meanings.sent1: She jockeyed the steering wheel to avoid the pothole.
meanings.sent2: He jockeyed the remote control to switch channels quickly.
meanings.sent3: The chef jockeyed the knife to chop the vegetables with precision.
meanings.sent4: The musician jockeyed the guitar strings to produce the perfect sound.
meanings.sent5: The artist jockeyed the paintbrush to create a masterpiece on the canvas.
